patterns: How one can avoid rusting of groundnut?
Preventions for rusting of groundnut?
What are the ways through which  rust disease can be avoided?
List the methods to control the rust disease of groundnut?
Measures to prevent rusting of groundnut disease?
responses:
Few measures are as below:
Crop rotation and field sanitation.
Strict plant quarantine regulations should be enforced to avoid the spread of rust on the pods or seeds to disease free areas.
3-4 Spray of Tridemorph 2gm/lit of water at 15-20 days interval gives good management of rust

Few measure are :
Crop rotation and field sanitation.
Spray application of Chlorothalanil 2g/lit or Mancozeb 2g/lit or Wettable sulphur 2g/lit of water on 35 and 50 days after sowing.
Intercropping of pearl millet or sorghum with groundnut (1:3) is useful in reducing the intensity of rust.

patterns: How to control peanut bud necrosis disease?
Measure to prevent necrosis problem in groundnut?
What to do to reduce necrosis problem in groundnut?
Solutions for peanut bud necrosis disease?
responses:
Few measures are as below:
Optimum plant population should be maintained.
spraying insecticides like dimethoate or thiamethoxam 30-35 days after sowing
Rogue out bud necrosis affected plant s up to 6 weeks after sowing.
Seed treatment with Chloropyriphos @6ml per kg seed followed by Mancozeb @ 3grams or Carbendazim @ 1gram per kg seed.

Few measure are :
Sowing should be done at optimum soil moisture level.
Intercropping of groundnut with castor or bajra or jowar in 7:1 ratio.
Optimum plant population should be maintained..

patterns: How to control peanut bud rod disease?
Measure to prevent rod problem in groundnut?
What to do to reduce rod problem in groundnut?
Solutions for peanut bud rod disease?
responses:
Few measures are as below:
Apply copper fungicides to protect lower fruit from spores in water splashed from the soil.
Optimum plant population should be maintained.
Rogue out bud necrosis affected plant s up to 6 weeks after sowing.
Seed treatment with Chloropyriphos @6ml per kg seed followed by Mancozeb @ 3grams or Carbendazim @ 1gram per kg seed.

Few measure are :
Sowing should be done at optimum soil moisture level.
Intercropping of groundnut with castor or bajra or jowar in 7:1 ratio.
Apply copper fungicides to protect lower fruit from spores in water splashed from the soil.
Optimum plant population should be maintained..

PM kisan

responses: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-KISAN) is a Central Sector scheme with 100% funding from Government of India. for more details visit pmkisan.gov.in
please visit our website pmkisan.gov.in
i request you to please visit our website pmkisan.gov.in
Under the Scheme an income support of Rs. 6000/- per year is provided to all farmer families across the country in three equal installments of Rs. 2000/- each every four months.

responses: Fertilizers for groundnut are following Ammonium sulphate,Calcium ammonium nitrate,Potassium sulphate,Gypsum,Potassium chloride.

patterns: What are the common diseases in Groundnut crop?
How to prevent groundnut crop from diseases?
What are the common symptoms of groundnut disease?
What can we do to prevent ground nut diseases?
How to recover from Groundnut diseases?
responses: Common diseases for groundnut are Early leaf spot,Late leaf spot,Rust disease,Stem rot,Alternaria leaf disease,Anthracnose disease.

patterns: How to use pesticides for groundut farming?
Are pesticides useful in curing groundnut crop diseases?
What pesticides are used in groundnut famrming?
What is the optimum quantity of pesticides in groundnut cultivation?
How to chooses the best pesticides for groundnut farming?
responses: Common pesticides used for groundnut are Targa Super  (Quizalofop Ethyl 5%),Vitavax Power  (Carboxin 37.5% + Thiram 37.5%),Lustre,Zerox (Propiconazole 25%),Sixer (Mancozeb 63% + Carbendazim 12%),Media (Imidacloprid 17.8%).
